description: From Middle English parclose, perclose, from Old French parclos, perclose and others, Middle French parclose (“end, enclosure”), noun use of past participle of parclore (“to enclose”).

entries.meaning: A partition that closes off part of a building; especially one that separates an altar or chapel from the rest of a church.
(heraldry) The lower half of a garter with the buckle.
(obsolete) An enclosed area, especially one separated from the main body of a building by a screen or partition.
